explanation: Agent A's claim is not correct. Rule 2.2 forbids dead code (operations whose removal would not affect program behaviour). The sizeof(...) != userhash_size checks in each case are defensive consistency checks: they compare a compile-time size of the table field to the runtime userhash_size (which was checked earlier against MHD_digest_get_hash_size(algo3)). There is no evidence in the snippet that MHD_digest_get_hash_size(algo3) is provably identical to the compile-time sizeof(...) in all translation units of the project, so the extra test is not provably redundant. Removing those checks could change behaviour if the digest-size function, the enum-to-size mapping, or the user_ids definition become inconsistent (now or after future changes). Therefore the code is not demonstrably dead and does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 on the basis given by Agent A.
